medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began suddenly on the morning of an unspecified date, which awoke him from sleep. It has been present for 5 days, is constant and located in the right upper quadrant, with variable severity. Associated symptoms include nausea but no vomiting. The patient reported a fever of 100.5 at home. Pain worsens with inspiration and movement, but improves with pain medication.
